pull.title: wallet: derivehdkey RPC to get xpub at arbitrary path
pull.body:
Based on #29136.

Given a (blank) wallet with an `unused(KEY)` descriptor, `derivehdkey "m/87h/0h/0h"` gets the xpub or xpriv at any given path.

This is particularly useful for multisig setup where it's not desirable to use our default derivations (e.g. 44h).

TODO:

- [ ] update multisig tutorial and demo tests to use this
- [ ] optional `hdkey` argument in case there's multiple `unused(KEY)` descriptors

committer Sjors Provoost <sjors@sprovoost.nl> 1750417174 +0200

descriptor: Add unused(KEY) descriptor

unused() descriptors do not have scriptPubKeys. Instead, the wallet uses
them to store keys without having any scripts to watch for.

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#bitcoin-core/gui/872](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/872) (Menu action to export a watchonly wallet by achow101)

* [#29136](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29136) (wallet: `addhdkey` RPC to add just keys to wallets via new `unused(KEY)` descriptor by achow101)
* [#28333](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28333) (wallet: Construct ScriptPubKeyMans with all data rather than loaded progressively by achow101)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
